document_title: Knee joint space stenosis: Causes, signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: hep-khe-khop-goi.json_3_Cause of narrow knee joint space
subsection_content:
Knee stenosis often results from loss of articular cartilage in the knee bones. In addition, some injuries related to the meniscus or anterior cruciate ligament tears have also been shown to have similar effects.
Risk factor
Age: The older you are, the more easily the cartilage degenerates, leading to narrowing of the joint space.; Injuries: Injuries from traffic accidents, sports accidents or excessive, repetitive movements can cause permanent joint damage and degeneration.; Overweight: This condition causes stress and puts excessive pressure on the joints, which in the long term can easily lead to degeneration.
